title: Design Thinking-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Enhancing Teacher Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens with intermediate-level domain expertise in social fields. They accumulate collaborative problem-solving experiences through project-based learning in a digital-device-provided environment.

learning_goals: Participants can apply the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to develop a social studies curriculum design proposal.
Participants can build a peer feedback system and derive collaborative improvement strategies through Professional Learning Community (PLC) activities.
Participants can propose a customized instructional design model that reflects actual educational contexts (student needs, local characteristics).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
